title: [REVIEW ONLY] Move autograd functions from VariableImpl to Variable
body_html:
Changes in this PR:

  1. Move Variable::Impl functions such as backward() / rebase_history() / grad_accumulator() / grad_fn() / set_data() out of Variable::Impl and into Variable. In those functions, we will use the getter to obtain the Variable's underlying Variable::Impl and perform the operations on it. (We need to make this change so that we can remove Variable::Impl class in the next PR.)

This is the 3rd PR mentioned in #13638, and is based on changes in the 2nd PR #13827.

This PR is only for collecting reviews. I will open another PR for merging this into master after #13827 is merged and this is approved.

This is the 3rd PR mentioned in #13638, and is based on changes in the 2nd PR #13827.
This PR is only for collecting reviews. I will open another PR for merging this into master after #13827 is merged and this is approved.
body:
Changes in this PR:
1. Move `Variable::Impl` functions such as `backward()` / `rebase_history()` / `grad_accumulator()` / `grad_fn()` / `set_data()` out of `Variable::Impl` and into `Variable`. In those functions, we will use the getter to obtain the Variable's underlying `Variable::Impl` and perform the operations on it. (We need to make this change so that we can remove `Variable::Impl` class in the next PR.)

This is the 3rd PR mentioned in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/13638, and is based on changes in the 2nd PR https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/13827. 

This PR is only for collecting reviews. I will open another PR for merging this into master after https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/13827 is merged and this is approved.
